content.description: A computer engineer is investigating whether the amount of installed <math alttext="R A M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RAM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (random access memory) can be used to predict the mean cost of a laptop with the operating system. The computer engineer collected a sample of 20 laptops with the same operating system. The engineer wants to estimate the mean change in the cost, in dollars, for each increase of 1 gigabyte of installed <math alttext="R A M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RAM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Assuming the conditions for inference have been met, which of the following inference procedures is the most appropriate for such an investigation?

choices.label: A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between proportions
A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference between means
A matched-pairs <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a mean difference
A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for means
A linear regression <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for slope

content.answer: A linear regression <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for slope

topic.text: 9.2: Confidence Intervals for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate inference method for confidence intervals.
